meanings.definition: Moving or situated towards the west.
meanings.sent1: The westerly sunsets painted the sky in beautiful colors.
meanings.sent2: The westerly side of the house gets the most sunlight in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The westerly breeze carried the scent of flowers through the garden.
meanings.sent4: The westerly migration of birds signaled the change of seasons.
meanings.sent5: The westerly direction always led them back home.

meanings.definition: A wind blowing from the west.
meanings.sent1: The sailors adjusted the sails to catch the westerly wind.
meanings.sent2: The picnic was perfect until a strong westerly wind blew away the tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The westerly wind played with the leaves, making them dance in the air.
meanings.sent4: The westerly wind whispered secrets as it passed through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The westerly wind carried the promise of rain in its gentle touch.
